subject: Football
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Joey Bullen kicked a 29-yard field goal in the second overtime and Navy then held as Pittsburgh inexplicably gambled by going for a winning touchdown on fourth down when a chip-shot field goal would have forced another overtime, and the Midshipmen defeated the Panthers, 48-45, last night in Pittsburgh.Pitt (2-4), losing its fourth in a row despite the freshman LeSean McCoy’s 165 yards rushing and three touchdowns in an almost defense-free game, appeared to be in position to win when Navy (4-2) settled for the field goal and the Panthers got the ball back with a chance to win. But, with Pitt facing fourth-and-goal at the Navy 2-yard line, Coach Dave Wannstedt went for the victory rather than the tie, and the freshman quarterback Pat Bostick overthrew tight end Darrell Strong in the end zone.The Panthers, in desperate need of a victory after losing to Virginia by 30 points and Connecticut by 20 in its last two games, never found a way to slow Navy quarterback Kaipo-Noa Kaheaku-Enhada, who ran for 122 yards and a score and threw for another.
